JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Elisabet Fura;Josep Casadevall
TEXT: The applicant , known variously as “ Blondje ” , “ NN cel CARDINAL ” and “ Nn . PICARDINAL.m.CARDINAL.CARDINAL ” , claims that he is a NORP national who was born on an unspecified date in the GPE . He was represented before the ORG by Mr J. Hemelaar , a lawyer practising in GPE .

On DATE the applicant was arrested on suspicion of having committed criminal offences . Because he refused to identify himself he was detained pursuant to LAW ) in order for his identity to be established . On DATE he was released and handed over to ORG ( vreemdelingenpolitie ) , who held him ( ophouding ) for the same purpose , pursuant to LAW ( Vreemdelingenwet CARDINAL ) . After this measure had been extended for TIME , the applicant was placed in GPE detention with a view to his expulsion ( vreemdelingenbewaring ) . In the course of an interview with ORG on DATE the applicant stated that he had NORP nationality but that he was not prepared to show his passport or another identity document – both of which he possessed – in order to prove his nationality . On DATE the applicant was released .
The applicant lodged appeals against his detention , which were dismissed by ORG ( rechtbank ) of GPE , sitting in GPE , by a decision of DATE .

On DATE ORG ( Afdeling Bestuursrechtspraak ) of ORG ( PERSON ) declared a further appeal ( QUANTITY beroep ) by the applicant inadmissible , holding that he had failed to fulfil the requirements of LAW ( PERSON ) by not including his name in the notice of appeal .

Since neither the application form , the authority to act ( which was signed “ X ” ) nor the supporting documents contained any mention of the applicant ’s name , the applicant ’s representative was requested on DATE to provide the ORG with a copy of a valid identity document for his client , as required by domestic law .

In his reply of DATE , the applicant ’s representative informed the ORG that no valid identity document was available , pointing out that the case concerned GPE detention and that NORP law did not require the submission of an identity document in such cases . Moreover , in view of the applicant ’s youth , there had likewise been no need or obligation for him to possess a document allowing him to cross international borders .
